text:
The Russian project of
[? pacha ?] [? batchi ?] is
important there.

It does tell you a little
bit about Turkish history,

development into the
neighboring areas of Turkey.

This was the time when
Turkey was getting
aware of the big market Russia.

And we were selling to Russia
from Turkish production.

But the customs duties,
duties were too high.

Duties were, in some cases,
killing the whole economy
of the product.

So we saw that Russia was
also drinking more beer.

Our container business
made the first factory
for container production.

Because the beer industry of
Turkey-- remember [? FS? ?]

The beer production
in Turkey had

moved for production
in Russia to supply
from their own local production.

Why do people prefer local
production in glassware,
for example?

In all these others,
I mean, the bottle

has to be because it's
a voluminous item.

For every kilo of glass or
for every cubic meter of glass

that you carry, containers are
much cheaper than glassware.

Glassware is the most
value added item.

You can travel with
it a certain distance.
We could travel even--

depending on the needs and
the price of the product,

you could travel
everywhere with glassware.

Why then make a
local production?

Because every market demands
certain locomotive items.
They are very cheap.

But if you don't produce them,
and if you don't give them

sufficiently into
your product mix,

you don't get the higher
value items as well.
So think about it as a pyramid.
